titles.title: Recognizing the significance of the 1973 New Mexico Bilingual Multicultural Education Act on its 50th anniversary and the importance of cultivating education in both the mother tongue as well as English for the preservation of culture, identity, and Indigenous knowledge.

Recognizing the significance of the 1973 New Mexico Bilingual Multicultural Education Act on its 50th anniversary and the importance of cultivating education in both the mother tongue as well as English for the preservation of culture, identity, and Indigenous knowledge.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.summary: This resolution supports efforts to incorporate bilingual multicultural education, increase the number of bilingual teachers and professors in the United States, and help tribes maintain and teach their Indigenous languages.
